shortContent:
If a creature with this trait takes damage and does not
deal damage or Insanity Points on other creatures by the end
of its next turn, it must make a Willpower Test. The creature
takes 1 damage for failure, plus 1 damage for each degree of
failure. If this would deal damage equal to or in excess of the
creature’s Wounds, it is cast back into the warp.
content:
Most warp-entities have a tenuous hold on our reality, often
maintained only by horror and bloodshed, and may be
disrupted if sufficient harm can be done to their manifested
forms. If a creature with this trait takes damage and does not
deal damage or Insanity Points on other creatures by the end
of its next turn, it must make a Willpower Test. The creature
takes 1 damage for failure, plus 1 damage for each degree of
failure. If this would deal damage equal to or in excess of the
creature’s Wounds, it is cast back into the warp.
